fulltext_conclaveformat.listicle_title: HERE ARE THE HIGHLIGHTS OF MODI\'S SPEECH

listicle_content.listicle: Indians in Qatar are never away from India even for a minute, they are re-living India on the soil of Qatar.
World is appreciating India\'s economic strategy.
Global investors want to invest in India.
The world economy too is not doing so well at this moment. Yet, despite this India is growing.
India has been growing despite the fact that the monsoon has not been very good for the last two years.
Global agencies are in agreement that if there is a fastest growing economy, it is India. Our growth rate is high.
The change in India has not happened due to Narendra Modi. It is due to the 125 crore people of India.
Corruption has troubled us for long, we are determined to eliminate it.

story.storykicker: "Indians in Qatar are never away from India even for a minute, they are re-living India on the soil of Qatar," said PM Modi.
story.storybody:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi today addressed the Indian community in Doha.

The prime minister reached Qatari capital Doha from Afghanistan on Saturday night where he was received by Prime Minister Abdullah bin Nasser bin Khalifa Al Thani.

India and Qatar today signed seven agreements, including on investment and tourism promotion, following delegation level talks headed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Qatar Emir Tamim Bin Hamad Al Thani.

{funfacts}

HERE ARE THE HIGHLIGHTS OF MODI'S SPEECH
  1. India's image has changed globally.
  2. Indians in Qatar are never away from India even for a minute, they are re-living India on the soil of Qatar.
  3. World is appreciating India's economic strategy.
  4. Global investors want to invest in India.
  5. The world economy too is not doing so well at this moment. Yet, despite this India is growing.
  6. India has been growing despite the fact that the monsoon has not been very good for the last two years.
  7. Global agencies are in agreement that if there is a fastest growing economy, it is India. Our growth rate is high.
  8. The change in India has not happened due to Narendra Modi. It is due to the 125 crore people of India.
  9. Corruption has troubled us for long, we are determined to eliminate it.
{funfacts}

This is the second prime ministerial visit from India to Qatar in eight years after Manmohan Singh's visit in 2008.

 

Also read:

India, Qatar sign 7 agreements to boost economic ties

#StrandedInDoha: Indian workers appeal to PM Modi for help
